questions.question: Everyone respects people ……………… are honest.
questions.description: We use who to refer to people and which to refer to things or animals.

questions.question: We saw the dog ………………… chased the cat.
questions.description: Both 'that' and 'which' can refer to animals or things.

questions.question: He ……………….. does his best shall be rewarded.
questions.description: The relative pronoun 'who' acts as the subject of the relative clause.

questions.question: She has gone to Mangalore ………………… is her native place.
questions.description: 'That' is not possible in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: I have never seen the bird ………………… you are talking about.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses, both 'that' and 'which' are possible.

questions.question: I know the man ………………… kidnapped the child.
You must give away ………………. you do not need.
There is no one ………………….. has not lost a dear one.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses 'who' and 'that' are both possible.

questions.question: Here is the phone ………………. you lost.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses both 'that' and 'which' can be used to refer to things.
